title: Rosemary Odinga still in hospital
text:
Rosemary Odinga still in hospital Thursday February 23 2017 Rosemary Odinga addressing residents in Marigat, Baringo County, on January 20,2017. She has been admitted to a city hospital for surgery. PHOTO | CHEBOITE KIGEN | NATION MEDIA GROUP Advertisement More by this Author 
Cord leader Raila Odinga’s daughter Rosemary is still being treated in hospital even as the family remained tight-lipped about her condition. 
Sources close to the Odinga family say that prior to her admission, Ms Odinga had complained of persistent migraines, which prompted her go to hospital for a CT scan of the head to determine what was causing the migraines. 
While the Nation could not ascertain Ms Odinga’s current condition, it is suspected that she could be having a tumour in her brain and is scheduled to undergo surgery to remove it. 
Sources also say that the family has requested privacy. 
“We are not sure of her condition but are equally worried. We have respected the distance the family has requested from us,” said the source. 
Ms Odinga was rushed to hospital on Friday last week and it is not clear whether the family knew about the existence of the tumour before she was hospitalised. Related Content Raila's daughter admitted to city hospital 
Ms Odinga is still at Aga Khan University Hospital. 
The Nation has, however, learnt that Mr Odinga’s second-born child — who is in the 2017 election race for the Kibera Parliamentary seat — is under the care of renowned neurosurgeon David Livingstone Oluoch-Olunya. 
Dr Oluoch-Olunya is a part-time consultant neurosurgeon at Aga Khan Hospital and also a family doctor to the Odingas. 
The neurosurgeon also operated on the Cord leader back in 2010 to relieve pressure that had built up around Mr Odinga’s brain. 
“People have been speculating about her condition because of the specialist but he is their family doctor and his specialisation should not be used to diagnose her,” the source added.
